please klick................

http://tinyurl.com/4l8z9

kindly look at pic 073f, near the rim at 9 to 11 o'clock area. I see 
traces of what looks like " lacquer ".
Is it possible in the edo days the whole flat surface was covered 
with black lacquer ?

Also look at pic 072f.............
the " strange shape hole " appeared to be made same time as the other 
holes ( kogai, kozuka ), I based this conclusion on the 
rust/condition of the inside of the holes ( one reason NOT to clean 
the holes ? ).  There is evidence that the tsuba were actually 
used/mounted.

All three tsuba came from the same source/collection, can we assumed 
they are meant for a single weapon ( e.g. a socket yari ) , like the 
samurai changed them like he changed cloths ?

milt
